p: Ethyl acetate extract of L. pubescens tested in the present study showed strong antibacterial activity against the six bacterial strains tested. However, antibacterial activities of the extracts dissolved in the other solvents were not observed. This could be caused by the difference in the chemical composition of these extracts. Often, variations in chemical composition may result from differences in the extraction solvents, season, and presence of secondary metabolites [ 35]. Previous studies have shown that lavender plants contain a broad variety of terpenes, including monoterpenes, sesquiterpenes, and diterpenes, as well as phenolic compounds exhibiting antimicrobial activity [ 36, 37, 38].
